page.title: 05CHARITIES
page.content: EBENEZER BRADWELL TRUST In 1956 the Ebenezer Bradwell Trust was set up to use the money that Ebenezer Bradwell, a local Methodist Preacher, had left to help people in need in a three and a half mile radius of the Bradwell Parish Church. The sum he left was invested and the interest used. The trust members meet about six times a year to provide gifts of food, flowers and occasionally money to people who have had accidents, are ill or have had upsetting experiences. ELIAS MARSHALL CHARITY This trust uses money from the rent of two fields left by Elias Marshall to purchase books for children in Bradwell Infant and Junior schools. Originally the money was used to pay for the education of Bradwell children whose parents could not afford to pay themselves.
